intro: Tanacetum leucophyllum, commonly known as the whiteleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with finely divided, silvery-gray leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Tanacetum leucophyllum is often used in ornamental gardening for its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
